intro: Medinilla nervosa, commonly known as the velvet tangerine or velvet tangerine plant, is a tropical shrub native to the Philippines. It is characterized by its waxy, velvety leaves that give it its common name, and its clusters of fragrant, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments and thrives in well-draining soil. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms. Medinilla nervosa is also valued for its potential medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
